page.title: 15CAMBERLOT HALL (cont.)
page.content: After landing, the airman and the rest of the crew were examined by an American doctor. This examination was carried out at what the airman calls a "fine mansion" somewhere near the airfield. The airman remembers the "fine mansion" under the name of Â£Camelot'. In 1984 resarch into this story was being carried out and the occupier of Camberlot hall recieved a letter with respect to this research. Letters to the south coast press and the national aviation magazine Â£Flypast' and reference to salvage records appear to confirm the whereabouts of the airfield. At this present moment in time it is still being established where the crew of the Liberator spent that night in July 1944 - but surely it was at Camberlot Hall !
